articles.author: Heekyong Yang, Josh Smith
articles.description: Han convened his cabinet and National Security Council after Saturday's impeachment vote and vowed to maintain military readiness to prevent any breach of national security.
articles.title: South Korea's acting president moves to reassure allies, calm markets after impeachment

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's impeachment on Saturday, suspending him from his official duties, capped 11 days of political crisis that roiled his country, sparked by his surprise decision to impose martial law.
articles.title: South Korean President Yoon's political implosion from martial law to impeachment

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu, Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia is pulling back its military from the front lines in northern Syria and from posts in the Alawite Mountains but is not leaving its two main bases in the country after the fall of President Bashar al-Assad, four Syrian officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia pulling back but not out of Syria, sources say

articles.author: Michel Rose
articles.description: Francois Bayrou will face a fractured and fractious parliament where one of his earliest tasks will be to pass a budget for 2025.
articles.title: Macron has a new prime minister but the same old problems

articles.author: Huseyin Hayatsever
articles.description: The new administration in Syria should be given a chance to govern following their constructive messages, and Turkey stands ready to provide military training if such help is requested, Turkish Defence Minister Yasar Guler said.
articles.title: Turkey ready to offer military training to Syria if new administration requests, minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah head Naim Qassem said on Saturday that the Lebanese armed group had lost its supply route through Syria, in his first comments since the toppling of President Bashar al-Assad nearly a week ago by a sweeping rebel offensive.
articles.title: Hezbollah chief says group lost its supply route through Syria

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain officially became the 12th member of a trans-Pacific trade pact which includes Japan, Australia and Canada on Sunday as it seeks to deepen ties in the region and build its global trade links after leaving the European Union.
articles.title: Britain joins trans-Pacific pact in biggest post-Brexit trade deal

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: In the final days leading to his ouster, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad complained to Iran's foreign minister that Turkey was actively supporting Sunni rebels in their offensive to topple him, two Iranian officials told Reuters this week.
articles.title: Before his ouster, Syria's Assad told Iran that Turkey was aiding rebels to unseat him

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia's government said on Sunday that five members of the "Bali Nine" drug ring have returned from Indonesia, after diplomatic efforts between the countries this month to strike a repatriation deal.
articles.title: Australia says remaining 'Bali Nine' members have returned from Indonesia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol did not comply with a summons from prosecutors on Sunday, and they plan to issue another order as they investigate his short-lived martial law decree, Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon defied prosecutors' summons in martial law probe, Yonhap reports
